content:
@Doc Jones posted a blog post describing our plans. Part of it is a request for folks to signup on this form:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1ffwJnGsQaY5-8TCtYMFtlc2Hhnn_vh_w_UWwPrBDHUM

She and I would like to pick a smaller group to run a smaller session at 2021-12-02T12:00:00-05:00. But as I described here, it's clear there's a lot of interest in reading clubs and I'd like to see more clubs happening in the future.

One comment is if you're a rustc hacker who'd like to help in running their own club, please reach out to @Doc Jones and I. Alternatively, if people want to read together on a more ad-hoc basis, you can always make a zoom room or google hangouts or what have you and give it a try!

Perhaps a codetour for Rustc?
https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vsls-contrib.codetour

This would be very helpful for new contributors, helping them to understand the codebase.

Milo123459 said:

Perhaps a codetour for Rustc?

neat

Vadim Petrochenkov said:

Oh well.

don't worry, I'm sure we'll have some questions for you afterwards :)
I missed the signup form, may I attend the reading club?
I am in the same boat as Frank, the signup form is now closed.

Hi @Frank King and @Jacob ! I'm happy to hear that you are interested in the club. Unfortunately, your timing is a bit off. As a result of the overwhelming attendance we had for the 1st session, it became clear that we needed to reduce attendance to a manageable size group. The current iteration of the Rustc Reading Club is invite only. Don't there will be more Rust Reading Clubs starting some time in early 2022. A few people have stepped forward to lead those so we will have the chance to participate if you want it.

I'm under the impression that there was so much demand that only a fraction of those who completed the form actually got a spot. So don't feel too bad about not having completed the form, as it might not have helped.
Ah that's unfortunate, I was at the first session but missed the circulation of the signup form. Thanks for responding

Thanks for reply :smile: . Hope there will be more reading clubs in the next year. And reading clubs in more timezones, if possible, since the Dec 2nd session is in midnight in my timezone :exhausted:

Oh damn. I was waiting to attend this club for a month now since the first time I read about it on smallcultfollowing.com. Could you please reconsider recording or live streaming it? I would like to start contributing to Rust soon and watching someone knowledgable in Rust codebase unravel their mind would be almost as helpful as attending the club. You know, seeing how rustc devs talk their minds would be a quick way to get familiar with things.

@Silap Aliyev see https://zulip-archive.rust-lang.org/stream/305296-rustc-reading-club/topic/Improving.20expectations.html - the reading club isn't going to be recorded, but DevinR528 recorded a stream of them making a PR which might be what you're looking for :)
